item.title: Black, 7th January
item.description:
Pavements not gritted around junction or any side roads leading to Oakhurst causing members of public to fall. Witnessed four separate members of the public fall over, one pregnant and one elderly with a dog. Witnessed lady on bicycle fall and injure hip, resulting in her going to hospital. Members of public were forced to walk in the road to avoid ungritted areas. Very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Upland Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Just outside 2 Cavendish Road /see photo/, 7th January
item.description:
Over the last week someone regularly dumps rubbish here, first there were mattresses, then furnitures, now there are clothes thrown out at the same spot. Unsightly, smelly, tripping hazard. Please investigate and arrange cleanup. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cavendish Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag (Estates)

item.title: About 3 metres passed traffic lights, 7th January
item.description:
I am reporting a dangerous loose pavement slab which has been unsafe for several months. On Wednesday 31 December 2025, I tripped on this loose slab and fell, sustaining injuries. I injured my hand, which has not improved, and I also sustained a visible bruise to my left knee. I attended hospital following the incident; however, due to extreme overcrowding, I am now being assessed by my GP, who is arranging referral to an X-ray clinic. The pavement slab has been loose from the ground on and off for over six months and presents a clear trip hazard to pedestrians. Please confirm this report has been logged, provide a reference number, and arrange for inspection and urgent repair to prevent further injuries.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Agar Grove, Kentish Town, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alleyn Park pavements and road not gritted by Southwark council, 7th January
item.description:
Has been treacherous since Saturday and is incredibly dangerous to walk on the pavements and drive. Roads have also been impacted by several burst water pipes compounding the extreme weather conditions.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Morkyns Walk, Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pile of rubbish outside gates of Elmfield lodge., 7th January
item.description:
Pile of rubbish dumped by entitled locals , outside Elmfield Lodge. Been there since Monday Jan 5th at least. A student fell over trying to avoid the pile on frozen footpath (another issue).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A21, Bromley Common, Greater London

item.title: Tree/garden waste fly tipped, 7th January
item.description:
Someone has cut a tree back and dumped the branches outside 31 Fountayne Road outside the property. The Tree cuttings match up. There is a skip on their front garden they could have used. The branches overhung no.31’s garden.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Fountayne Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Drains STILL blocked; reported several times, 7th January
item.description:
I have reported this problem for several years running; all three drains are totally blocked up with residue / leaves and debris and have been for over four years. We all pay huge sums in council tax for things like this, why is it I have to report this issue. Do Bromley Council monitor or plan any maintenance ? Can you please organise a contractor to sort this problem out once and for all. It keeps flooding and causing problems, especially to elderly residents, cars and cyclists .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Georges Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbush bin plus, 7th January
item.description:
The bibs in Butt's Wood have not been emptied dibce before xmas, the cushion dumped in fito was there before I went on holiday over xmas, there us also a black sack by another bin, bern there same amount if time !! No picker has been since well before xmas as some paper on grass more up the pathway towards exit to galliobs reach health center, still there from 22 dec when I walked my dog past. This park area seems to get forgotten, but students from both schools use thus area to get to bus stop , cut throughs, they live to dump stuff in canal, there's a trolly there now, no doubt next week it will also be in the canal! Bags of dog poo in bags sitting on top of bins, as they are full.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Butts Wood Path, Thamesmead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti 'oops' on electric box, 7th January
item.description:
More 'oops' graffiti has been done on the electric box outside property 17. Please can I ask the council to remove this. Also if they can check all down the street and clean other tags too. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
